Wrong game, sorry.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Guillotine is a Burst III attacker who wields an LMG, and gets stronger the more she loses HP - just like a berserker. She is a high-risk, high-reward DPS that reaches full potential the closer she edges to being dead - thanks to her Skill 2 that increased her ATK depending on how much HP she has lost. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"She has both great sustained damage and burst damage tied to her Burst skill, but she needs to be below 50% to really hurt the target. review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Harran is a Burst III sniper rifle attacker specializing in dealing damage over time that spreads between enemies on their deaths. Furthermore, her Skill 2 allows her to penetrate enemies with each fully charged shot, as well as increase her own ATK for every kill she gains. The stacking ATK Buff not only makes her DoTs hit like a truck but also makes her Burst clear the whole screen if she has enough stacks - it has a nearly 1000% multiplier, one of the highest in the game.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Be aware that while the ATK buff is dependent on her killing enemies, with how much damage she brings, it's easy to stack it. Honestly, in the damage department, she's only inferior to Scarlet.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Harran's only downside is the fact she belongs to the Pilgrim faction and because of that, it will be harder to not only obtain but also max her.　","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Liter is a Burst I SMG supporter who specializes in lowering the overall cooldown of the team’s Burst Skills. review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Ludmilla is a Burst I SMG Defender who not only perfectly fulfills the role of a tank in the team, but on top of that can debuff enemies and buff allies. Honestly, it's ridiculous how much is packed in her kit and that's why currently she's the best Defender in the game. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"What makes her great at tanking is that her taunt is combined with a self-buff that decreases the amount of damage she takes allowing her to shrug off more than half the damage the taunted enemies deal. In addition to her great tanking abilities, she can also lower the ATK and DEF of enemies she attacks with her S1 (although it's worth mentioning the debuff value is pretty low), and also she can buff the DEF of her allies with her Burst skill - which has only 20 seconds cooldown. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her weakness is that her weapon of choice is an SMG which limits her range and that she is purely focused on being defensive support.　","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Milk is a Burst I Sniper Rifle buffer that can provide ATK buff to 2 main DPS as well as give the whole team a permanent Crit Damage buff. You just have to make sure she stays healthy (above 80% HP), for the Crit Damage buff to work, but that's easy to do even without a healer since she has Lifesteal built into her kit that also affects her allies.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Overall, Milk is a decent support that will make your damage dealers even stronger, but her issue is that her cooldowns are really long. The ATK buff can be activated every 20 seconds (and it lasts for 10 seconds), but it isn't as bad as her Burst cooldown - 40-second cooldowns are rare among the Burst I category. This means that if you want to use Milk, you need to pair her with another Burst I character that has a 20-second cooldown Burst or you will drastically lower the damage output of the team.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Miranda is a Burst I SMG supporter who sacrifices everything to buff her allies. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her Critical Damage buff is one of the strongest in the game and it lasts for a decent amount of time - and it affects all allies. She can also slightly increase the hit rate for her team allowing them to do more damage outside of their weapon range. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Sadly, despite all the top-tier buffs, you rarely play with just a single damage dealer - so it's hard to justify using Miranda over other buffers that are more team-oriented.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Noah is a Burst II rocket launcher Defender that specializes in tanking damage for the team. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"She is capable of taunting the enemies in 2 ways. She can taunt a target for 2 seconds (and lower its attack on top of that) with every fully charged shot she takes and after using her Burst, she will taunt all enemies while at the same time giving Invincibility and DEF buff to all her allies. The second taunt also lasts for 10 seconds which should be enough time to recover from dire situations.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"While she sounds like a perfect tank, she has two glaring weaknesses. Her S1 has a very low activation chance (only 10%) and it relies on her being attacked (which will be easy to trigger during with her Burst skill, but pretty hard with her S2) and that she's a Rocket Launcher user which limits her Rate of Fire.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Noise is a Burst I Defender that can provide healing and damage reduction to her team. Unlike Ludmilla who can only taunt when using Burst Skill, Noise can taunt any enemy with a Fully charged shot with her Rocket Launcher - though the taunt only lasts for 2 seconds. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"While she is classified as Defender, she excels more at healing - mainly thanks to her Burst skill that increases her and her team's max HP and then heals them. This skill provides the highest burst healing in the game, but it comes at a heavy downside of having 40 seconds cooldown. So to make the most use of it, you would need to pair her with characters that reduce the burst's cooldown.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Overall, Noise's biggest issue is that she tries to do two things at once - tank and heal - and with how her skills work, makes her average at both. Of all the hybrids the developers added to the game, she lacks synergy between both sides the most because she can't do both at once - she either tanks when her burst is on cooldown or heals when she uses it.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Furthermore, being Burst I character she competes for that spot with Ludmilla, but also other great Burst I characters like Liter, Pepper, and Volume.\n\n","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

review.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Private is a Burst III attacker who wields an assault rifle and is capable of stunning enemies. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"She has a very stacked kit - she is capable of buffing, stunning, and doing burst damage. Her buffs revolve around providing ATK and reload speed to her team as well as reducing their magazine capacity allowing units that rely on Last Bullet mechanics to trigger them frequently. Her Skill 2 is where the majority of her damage comes from, although on the condition that the enemy target is stunned by her Burst Skill. As there are no other units that can stun, her Skill 2 can be hard to utilize with a short 3-second stun.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"In the CBT, she was available for free from beginner mission, and this won't change for the full release, she will be a staple in any team.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Scarlet is a Burst III assault rifle attacker that primarily does anime damage to enemies. Yes, anime damage. Honestly, I don't know why she belongs to AR category if she wields a sword, but at least it looks damn cool!","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Scarlet is a high-reward, high-risk character who gets stronger as her HP gets lower. Though compared to Guillotine - another character that has a berserker-like kit - she deals more damage thanks to the Critical Rate and Critical Damage buffs (but keep in mind that they are only active when she's below a certain HP%). ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Scarlet's only weakness is that her reload time is pretty long (2.30 seconds), so you need to pair her with characters that can reduce reload speed or increase ammunition capacity to unlock her full potential. Still, even if you play her in a non-optimal way, she's still the best damage dealer in the game that beat all other attackers in the tests we did.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Soline is a Burst III SMG attacker who is the weakest DPS in her category. Mainly because her kit has many flaws.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"First of all, the ATK Speed bonus barely does anything considering that she's already using an SMG that is shooting really fast. So that's one useless passive. To make things worse, her Critical chance and Critical Damage self-buffs are also very low and they only are active when she's on full HP. The same HP condition is tied to her Burst DMG so even if she is missing 1% of her HP when you reach Burst Mode, her damage will be terrible as the majority of the skills' damage is locked behind her being at 100% HP.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"She only shines in stages where most of the enemies spawn in short range, as there her SMG weapon actually works well, but why would you use her, if any Shotgun wielder will deal way more damage in that scenario?","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Yulha is a Burst III Sniper Rifle wielder who is an attacker and supporter hybrid.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"She especially shines when paired with Guillotine and Scarlet as she can lower the amount of damage they take from enemies while still keeping them at low HP to unlock their full potential. Though it's worth knowing that her share damage only works with enemy damage and not the self-damage they do to themselves. She can also increase all allies' ATK, but the skill has a very long, 30-second cooldown. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Overall she has a good niche kit that is hampered by long cooldowns on her S2 and Burst.　","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"italic"}],"value":"What happens when you give a Sadist a rocket launcher instead of a whip?","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Yuni is a Burst II Defender who wields a rocket launcher and in reality, is more of a Supporter instead.
